API Reference

This page contains the API reference for all public classes and functions in PySCSA.

Core Classes

SCSA1D

class pyscsa.SCSA1D(gmma: float = 0.5)[source]

Bases: SCSABase

1D Semi-Classical Signal Analysis for signal reconstruction and filtering.

This class implements both standard SCSA and C-SCSA (with automatic h optimization) for 1D signal processing.

reconstruct(signal: ndarray, h: float = 1.0, lambda_g: float | None = None) → SCSAResult[source]

Reconstruct a 1D signal using SCSA.

Parameters:

  • signal (np.ndarray) – Input signal (will be converted to positive if negative)

  • h (float, default=1.0) – Semi-classical parameter

  • lambda_g (float, optional) – Lambda parameter. If None, set to 0

Returns:

Object containing reconstruction results

Return type:

SCSAResult

filter_with_optimal_h(signal: ndarray, curvature_weight: float = 4.0, h_range: Tuple[float, float] | None = None) → SCSAResult[source]

Filter 1D signal using C-SCSA with automatic h optimization.

Parameters:

  • signal (np.ndarray) – Input noisy signal

  • curvature_weight (float, default=4.0) – Weight for curvature penalty in cost function

  • h_range (Tuple[float, float], optional) – Range for h parameter search. If None, automatically determined

Returns:

Object containing filtered signal and optimal parameters

Return type:

SCSAResult

denoise(noisy_signal: ndarray, **kwargs) → ndarray[source]

Convenience method for signal denoising.

Parameters:

  • noisy_signal (np.ndarray) – Input noisy signal

  • **kwargs – Additional parameters passed to filter_with_optimal_h

Returns:

Denoised signal

Return type:

np.ndarray

SCSA2D

class pyscsa.SCSA2D(gmma: float = 2.0)[source]

Bases: SCSABase

2D Semi-Classical Signal Analysis for image reconstruction.

This class implements 2D SCSA using separation of variables approach for image processing and reconstruction.

reconstruct(image: ndarray, h: float = 10.0, lambda_g: float = 0) → SCSAResult[source]

Reconstruct a 2D image using SCSA with separation of variables.

Parameters:

  • image (np.ndarray) – Input 2D image

  • h (float, default=10.0) – Semi-classical parameter

  • lambda_g (float, default=0) – Lambda threshold parameter

Returns:

Object containing reconstruction results

Return type:

SCSAResult

reconstruct_windowed(image: ndarray, h: float = 10.0, window_size: int = 4, stride: int = 1, lambda_g: float = 0) → ndarray[source]

Reconstruct image using windowed SCSA approach.

Parameters:

  • image (np.ndarray) – Input 2D image

  • h (float, default=10.0) – Semi-classical parameter

  • window_size (int, default=4) – Size of sliding window

  • stride (int, default=1) – Stride for sliding window

  • lambda_g (float, default=0) – Lambda threshold

Returns:

Reconstructed image

Return type:

np.ndarray

denoise(noisy_image: ndarray, method: str = 'windowed', **kwargs) → ndarray[source]

Convenience method for image denoising.

Parameters:

  • noisy_image (np.ndarray) – Input noisy image

  • method (str, default='windowed') – Method to use (‘standard’ or ‘windowed’)

  • **kwargs – Additional parameters passed to reconstruction method

Returns:

Denoised image

Return type:

np.ndarray

Visualization

SCSAVisualizer

class pyscsa.SCSAVisualizer[source]

Bases: object

Visualization utilities for SCSA results.

static plot_1d_comparison(original: ndarray, reconstructed: ndarray, title: str = 'SCSA 1D Reconstruction', figsize: Tuple[int, int] = (12, 5))[source]

Plot comparison between original and reconstructed 1D signals.

Parameters:

  • original (np.ndarray) – Original signal

  • reconstructed (np.ndarray) – Reconstructed signal

  • title (str) – Plot title

  • figsize (Tuple[int, int]) – Figure size

static plot_2d_comparison(original: ndarray, reconstructed: ndarray, title: str = 'SCSA 2D Reconstruction', figsize: Tuple[int, int] = (15, 5), cmap: str = 'gray')[source]

Plot comparison between original and reconstructed 2D images.

Parameters:

  • original (np.ndarray) – Original image

  • reconstructed (np.ndarray) – Reconstructed image

  • title (str) – Plot title

  • figsize (Tuple[int, int]) – Figure size

  • cmap (str) – Colormap for display

static plot_metrics(metrics: dict, title: str = 'SCSA Performance Metrics')[source]

Create a bar plot of performance metrics.

Parameters:

  • metrics (dict) – Dictionary of metrics

  • title (str) – Plot title

Data Structures

SCSAResult

class pyscsa.SCSAResult(reconstructed: ndarray, eigenvalues: ndarray, eigenfunctions: ndarray, num_eigenvalues: int, optimal_h: float | None = None, metrics: dict | None = None)[source]

Container for SCSA computation results.

reconstructed: ndarray
eigenvalues: ndarray
eigenfunctions: ndarray
num_eigenvalues: int
optimal_h: float | None = None
metrics: dict | None = None
